intro: Aquilegia atropurpurea var. brevistyla, commonly known as the dark purple columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features striking dark purple to nearly black flowers with five spurred petals, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are alternate along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in moist woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
